title: feature request: copy password
author: TristisOris
body_snippet:
it's implemented at Remote Desktop Manager Free. almost killer feature for me.
now we can copy only hostname
![изображение](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1270117/161622623-cd30015a-eb61-4380-b751-8df0e556a6f3.png)
but this is required much more often.
![изображение](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1270117/161622716-98d0399e-6d90-4b51-8174-fba5b9a4c2e2.png)

for ex: after ssh login i anyway need sudo, so should type password again. Without this option need to copy it f...

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet: noted, its another idea to allow advanced scripting (still as idea) that will allow to use variables like {{hostUserName}}, {{hostUserPassword}} and this can be used in run_command option to engage after login, without exposing that password (as its a situation then passwords can be controlled centralised, and host login password not always same as sudo :) but will think about it

comments.author: tsew2674
comments.snippet: I almost hate to say this bc it may be "fixed" for security, but you can currently copy the password by highlighting the word Password in the config and pressing Ctrl+C on the keyboard...I use this a lot and it's always the first thing I test when I update MRemoteNG

comments.author: kfordaccela
comments.snippet: From a security perspective I have to agree that "Copy Password" could cause some rather large security issues. If interested in ability to copy/paste password for SUDO perhaps a password manager like Keepass should be useds so that it's not necessary to remember passwords after connecting.
